results.title: Friend or foe
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Gordon L.T. Scott and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s feature set in Britain during World War 2 that focuses on the experiences of two London boys sent to board with a farming family during the period of heavy bombing. On one particular day the pilot from a ditched German bomber saves one boy from drowning and the boys must then decide whether or not to tell the English authorities of the German’s whereabouts. This film is useful for discussion about the sense of war, concepts of right and wrong, the nature of friendship and loyalty, peer group pressure and family relationships. Based on the novel by Michael Morpugo, script by John Krish.

results.title: Turning 18
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman, Open Channel Productions and Video Projects
results.brief_description: An amusing look at some serious issues that are related to turning eighteen - the age by which a person is legally recognised as an adult in this society. This program, subtitled, “Almost 20 Minutes” is a parody of the current affairs television program, “60 Minutes”.

results.title: Putting people away
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Psychiatrists have the responsibility for deciding who should and who shouldn’t be locked away, whose behaviour is merely eccentric and who is in fact, mentally ill. This program looks at the effect on people’s civil liberties when they are forcibly detained and questions whether it is necessary for the mentally ill to be hospitalised at all.

results.title: Indian cooking, Parsi style
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look ‘n’ Cook”.
The Parsi community originated 1,353 years ago, when a small group of people migrated from ancient Persia to India. Today there are hardly 100,000 members of this community in existence. The secrets of their culinary art - the ingredients and style of their cooking - are revealed in this program.

results.title: The Floor is yours (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, Management Training Ltd and Richard Need Productions
results.brief_description: A case study which tells the story of a young manager about to give his first business presentation and how he is saved from panic by help from an unexpected source. He discovers that good preparation is more than half the battle in successful communication and learns a tried and tested method that will see him through every kind of public speaking occasion.

results.title: You keep juggling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
One of a series of films that examines the history of immigration to Australia. This film discusses the assimilation of different cultures. Migrants speak of their experience as young people assimilation in Australia. For many there has been the conflict of finding a balance of identity between their parent’s home country values and Australian values.

group.title: Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788

results.title: Foreigners
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
One of a series of films that examines the history of immigration to Australia. In this film, “White Australians” give their opinions on the migrant influx, while Irish, Chinese, English and Turkish migrants relate instances of intolerance in Australia. They refer to situations of race, language or cultural difference and of economic pressure. In this film, social commentator Phillip Adams, academic Dinny O’Hearn and (former) RSL President Bruce Ruxton also make comments on matters relating to national identity.
